concept.title: Abstract
concept.shortdesc: [Enter the short description here in 1-2 sentences. Describe any changes made from the previous version].

conbody.p: Global or regional content: [Global, AMER, APAC, EMEA, LATAM]

Standard category content: Choose one: [APD, Business Process, Cloud Updates, Competency, Digital, Data Management, Data Migration, Functional, Infrastructure, Integration, Methodology, Operational, Performance, Program Management Office, Security, Tools, Testing, Test Data, Transition]

concept.shortdesc: Introductory, high-level overview summarizing the standard. Keep to 2-3 sentences maximum.

conbody.p: Identify the audience for this document. For example, specific roles, why the standard was created; what problems it solves for the customer, and why it matters/why they want to adopt it.
Included here are sample Styles that are built into this template. Use the styles that make the most sense for organizing your document.

section.title: Section heading style
section.p: Use this heading for information that rolls up under Concept heading style

Bulleted lists must be introduced with a sentence in normal text. Long lists should be numbered.
"List Bullet" is the style for bulleted lists.
"List Bullet" is the style for bulleted lists.
"List Bullet 2" is the style for 2nd-level bullets. Use sparingly.

[IMAGES: If you have an image file, insert a .jpg or .png format. If your document requires translation and your image has text embedded on it, provide a separate document with the text that needs to be translated when you submit for publishing.]
Use captions only if there is more than one image per document. Do not use captions for tables.

conbody.p:
Following is an example of a table. Introduce tables with a sentence or two summarizing what the table conveys. Table rows and columns may be added or deleted, as long as it fits in the template margins.
Requirement
Legacy Billing System
Guidewire BillingCenter
Accuracy
Extensive manual entry and little automated validation lead to invoice inaccuracies and subsequent customer disputes
Automated processes and configurable validation rules greatly increase invoice accuracy and reduce volume of customer disputes around billing
Account-level billing
Few legacy billing systems support account-level billing so insureds with multiple policies receive multiple bills for each billing cycle
Full support for account-level billing means insureds receive a single bill for each payment cycle
Flexible payment options
Support for traditional payment methods only and integration with external payment engines is onerous
Native support for common payment methods; can easily be integrated with any external payment engine

row.entry:
Add questions here for CPD to evaluate during technical review.
CPD will add questions to the Assessment Tool and provide Question IDs to populate here.
Provide additional guidance on how to assess the question. It could reference areas of code to review, relevant sections of the standard, recommendations on how to address the issue, and so on.

ul.li: External Standards: List titles of supporting documents that will be published with the standard on Guidewire Community and/or links to external websites.
Internal Standards Only: List the titles of any supporting documents and links on SurePath Methodology.
